narrative.title: Sabratha Division - 1941Q1
narrative.situation: Italian Auto-transportable Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q1.
narrative.objectives: Auto-transportable infantry division - partial motorization for improved mobility in desert operations. Designed for rapid deployment and mobile defense.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain transitioning to rocky desert (Via Balbia corridor)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Partial motorization (auto-transportable) - improved mobility vs. standard infantry divisions
Organic tank battalion (VI Tank Battalion with 37x M13/40)
Greater reconnaissance capacity with armored cars

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain transitioning to rocky desert (Via Balbia corridor)
